LockView.Sett.Enable_Hint: Enables the module on the local (TV's) client
LockView.Sett.ScreenWidth_Hint: The real world screen width in mm or inch. Must be set on the local (TV's) client
LockView.Sett.Gridsize_Hint: The real world grid size in mm or inch (e.g. 25 mm or 1 inch). Unit has to be the same as 'Screen Width'. Must be set on the local (TV's) client
LockView.Sett.ForceEnable_Hint: Enables the module on all non-GM clients
LockView.Sett.LockOverride_Hint: Enter a keybinding to override the zoom and pan lock
LockView.Scene.Autoscale.Label: Autoscale
LockView.Scene.Autoscale_Hint: Automatically calculates a scaling factor to either fit the scene to the screen, or so the grid is always the same physical size on the screen. This is overridden by the Bounding Box setting. Panning is not disabled by default
LockView.Scene.ForceInit_Hint: Forces the view to the 'Initial View Position' after loading the scene. Note: only works if 'Autoscale' is set to 'Off'
LockView.Scene.boundingBox_Hint: Limit zoom and pan to stay within a bounding box. By default this is the whole canvas, but this can be defined by drawing a rectangle and editing the drawing configuration. This overrides autoscaling
LockView.SetView.Title: Set View
LockView.boundingBox.Note:
You can force player pan and zoom to stay within a bounding box.
This needs to first be enabled in the 'Scene Configuration'.

Disabled: the bounding box is equal to the scene
Owned Tokens: Only force to this box if the player owns a token within the box.
Always: Always force players to stay within this box.
LockView.boundingBox.Label: Force to bounding box
LockView.UI.NoConnect: No connected and enabled clients on this scene
